page.title: 15CLUBS
page.content: About 32% of the clubs in this area are{social}such as bingo, work clubs, residents associations and choirs. They cater mainly for adults, some having a membership of over 500. {Youth}movements make up the next 28%, e.g. Youth clubs, Scouts and Guides, with an average membership of 40. {Sports}clubs (14%) for fishing, bowls, soccer, and gymnastics are mainly for adults. Average membership is 100. {Adult Education}(14%) offers keep-fit, flower arranging, photography, French, cooking and dancing. {Political}clubs (12%) include Labour, Conservative, Liberal/ S.D.P. and have an average membership of 1000. There are also{religious}fellowships. {Schools}also offer clubs for sports, hobbies and recreation e.g. chess, music, dance, bridge, computers, science and public speaking.
